info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 12:18AM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT SOUTHEASTERN GREENE... SOUTHEASTERN FAYETTE...MONONGALIA...SOUTHEASTERN WETZEL...PRESTON AND MARION COUNTIES THROUGH 115 AM EDT... At 1218 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Rockhill Furnace to Vienna. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. Locations impacted include... Morgantown, Fairmont, Westover, Kingwood, Mannington, Star City, Terra Alta, Pleasant Valley, Winfield, Farmington, Barrackville, Point Marion, Monongah, Granville, Pine Grove, Fairview, Newburg, Brookhaven, Cassville, and Jacksonburg. This includes the following highways... Interstate 68 in West Virginia between mile markers 1 and 31. Interstate 79 in Pennsylvania near mile marker 0. Interstate 79 in West Virginia between mile markers 130 and 160. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 300 AM EDT for southwestern Pennsylvania...and northern and northeastern West Virginia.
